name: Nel Henol
description: An enthusiastic, practiced bargainer and negotiator, Nel Henol is always pushing a new service or sale to her customers. She’s also on the Gorensla payroll, acting as the kajidic’s eyes and ears for any unusual activity at Bog Bay.

name: Riar Royal Guard
description: Local Royal Guard Patrol Officers monitor Bog Bay for criminal activities. Though not as elite as the ones in Toydor, they can be formidable against the local criminal element. One of their most important duties is to ensure that the flight restrictions in the area are followed; they are notoriously uncompromising concerning any violations they find.

name: Toydarian Infochant
description: The PCs might wish to confer with a local infochant to gain information concerning Walisi or the statue. Several are in the Bog Bay area. Developing one or more as well-paid contacts could not only gain the PCs a valuable resource but also help establish a false pretence if they are using aliases as part of their hunt.

name: RT-3PO
description: Brought on to aid in translations and negotiations, RT-3PO has excelled especially in running Walisi’s auctions. It is loyal and competent but scarcely a fighter, and it was lucky not to have been seriously damaged in the attack.

name: Cleaning Droid
description: Walisi purchased a series of these droids some time ago. He has since upgraded them regularly to ensure they properly maintain his establishment without damaging and of his items through overzealous dusting or improperly applied cleaning liquids.

weapons.name: Built-in cleaning spray hose
weapons.notes:
Disorient can be activated if sprayed in the target’s eyes.

Knockdown can be activated if sprayed on the floor, in which case the cleaning fluid remains on the floor for the rest of the encounter causing all characters in the area to make a :hard: Coordination check or fall prone.

name: Wrecker
description: One of the more prominent mercenaries operating in the region, Wrecker styles himself as more than just a cheap tough. Lately, he has been branching out into information brokering. Although the bulk of his credits still come from violence — like the theft and kidnapping the PCs are investigating — he knows time catches up with everyone, and that he needs to shift to a less physical line of work at some point if he wants to maintain his power base.

name: Toydarian Agent
description:
Jerserra has a small group of agents of Toydaria. Its members keep a low profile due to the Hutt operations here. Led by “Boss” Trelon, the group was an almost-forgotten part of her growing power base until one of its members reported news of the auction. Immediately recognising the shard within the satue, Jerserra ordered the agents to arrange to retrieve it and kidnap its seller. Now, they hold Walisi and *Tragic Hope*, awaiting her arrival.

The GM can use the following profile as needed for Loorek, Ileon, or any of the other local Toydarians who server Jerserra on this world.

name: Walisi
description: Walisi has run his shop for years now, slowly rising in influence across Toydaria and becoming known at an interstellar level. Though he has been somewhat concerned about how much power the Gorensla kajidic has over him, so far the arrangement has been mutually profitable. He had anticipated that the auction of *Tragic Hope* would be his grandest achievement yet, but he was quite unprepared for the unwanted attention it brought — perhaps enough to make the statue his final acquisition.
notes: Suffering 7 Wounds, 6 Strain, and 7 Critical Injuries.

name: Preelos Consortium Customised Security Droid
description: These droids are deployed throughout the mansion and normally they are quite effective in maintaining security. When faced with the superior firepower that the Gorensla enforcers bring to bear at the start of their brash attack, however, they are little more than a distraction. On the other hand, later on, as the Gorensla forces are thinned, these droids could help turn the tide.

name: ISB Security Droid
description: Jerserra’s agents earlier stole and reprogrammed these more advanced and dangerous ISB model to patrol the mansion as well. They more than make up for their lower numbers with superior firepower and armour plating.

name: Gorensla Weequay Enforcer
description: The Gorensla kajidic has many blasters-for-hire on its payroll. Most don’t survive their first assignment, but there are always more to be found. The clan uses Weequay enforcers quite often, some of whom have already been operating as bounty hunters or bodyguards.

name: Pravon, Gorensla Lieutenant
description: Pravon has led one of the Gorensla’ primary enforcer groups for only a few months, and he is eager to prove himself worthy of even higher advancement. He has extensive cybernetics, including an artificial voice box. This allows Pravon to be even louder than he was before, something he uses effectively to goad his fellow Weequay into even greater acts of violence against the kajidic’s enemies.

name: “Boss” Trelon
description: Trelon has gone by “Boss” since Jerserra assigned him as commander of her smuggling/information-gathering group on Toydaria, and he has lived up to the nickname. He’s developed a wide net of informants through intimidation and blackmail in order to further her cause (and his own). While loyal to Jerserra, he’s also ambitious. He hopes to impress her enough with his work that she advances him to greater power within her operation.

name: Jerserra’s Mercenary
description: Over the years, Jerserra has gathered many unsavoury types from a variety of Outer Rim species to her side. Most are in it simply for the credits, but some feel she is more than just another merc leader. She has vision, and aiding her can only lead to powerful roles for themselves in the future she is building.
notes: Armed with either a blaster carbine or a vibro-ax.

name: Jerserra (Early)
description: It’s been many years since she left Dathomir, but Jerserra never forgot the legends of the Nardithi. Through her recent Force visions from the shard she possesses, she feels sure that finally she has found a link that will reveal the resting place of the lost cluster.

abilities.name: Force Power: Jerserra’s Influence
abilities.description: Jerserra may spend :forcepip: and target one character within Short range. That character must immediately make an :average: fear check as an out-of-turn Incidental. If the target suffers Strain as a result of that fear check, she recovers from an equal amount of Strain. She may also spend :forcepip: to extend the power’s range to Medium.

abilities.name: Force Power: Move
abilities.description: Jerserra may spend :forcepip: to move one Silhouette 0 object within Short range to another location within Short range. She can spend :forcepip: to increase range one band, spend :forcepip: to increase Silhouette movable to 1, and spend :forcepip: to increase number of objects movable at one time by one (to a maximum of two). Jerserra can hurl objects by making a Move Force power check and rolling a ranged attack as part of the pool. The attack’s difficulty is equal to the Silhouette of the object being thrown and only succeeds if she can spend enough :forcepip: to move the object. The attack deals damage equal to the Silhouette of the object times 10 (Silhouette 0 deals 5 damage) plus one per :success:. To throw multiple objects, she must generate enough :forcepip: to move multiple objects, and must use rules for Auto-Fire to determine difficulty and targeting.

abilities.name: Force Power: Unleash
abilities.description: Jerserra makes a Force power check and targets one enemy at Short range, and rolls a ranged attack as part of the pool, using an :average: Discipline check instead of normal difficulty. If the check is successful and generates :forcepip::forcepip: the attack deals 3 damage with a critical rating of 4, plus 1 additional damage per :success:. May spend :forcepip: to increase damage by 2, and :forcepip: to increase range to Medium.

weapons.name: Unleash
weapons.notes: May spend :forcepip: to increase damage by 2 and :forcepip: to increase range to Medium.

name: Irrica the Hutt
description: Irrica’s life on Toydaria is near perfect. As Gorensla’s leader in Riar, she enjoys a great deal of power, albeit on the local stage. The ongoing rivalry with the Desilijic kajidic, however, has reached an intolerable level; she has started to see Desilijic’s machinations (whether real or imagined) in each recent setback and failure.
gear: Other equipment available from kajidic upon demand

name: Grax and Gremka
description: Twin Toydarians from a village outside of Arnel, Grax and Gremka work mostly as annra farmers, but they ave made a side operation out of leading expeditions into the surrounding swamplands. Their rapid-fire negotiating style, whereby they seem to argue more with each other than actually haggle over their fees as guides, is often very effective with those unprepared for their act.

abilities.name: Twin Negotiators
abilities.description: When working together, can spend :advantage::advantage: to add automatic :success: or :threat::threat: to add automatic :failure: when making opposed social checks.

name: Siluuk Eel
description:
A valued source of food, these snakelike fish range from one to eight metres in length and have glowing rings running the length of their bodies. Farmers in Arnel grow and harvest them in huge numbers for local sale and shipment off-world. Tending is an athletic endeavour, as the eels fight the farmers each step of the process, often by leaping several metres out of the water to snap at one of the hovering Toydarians.

Siluuk Eels can be found in a variety of sizes depending on their maturity, but all can be aggressive regardless of their size.

abilities.name: Siluuk Glow
abilities.description: In darkness, emits a phosphorescent glow that can be as illuminating as a bright light.

name: Yeel Dresk
description: Yeel has seen his triumphant sale of *Tragic Hope* turn from riches in credits to a ruin of a crashed starship. As his lack of repair skills is matched only by his stubbornness, he has yet to leave the planet. Now stranded in a roaring river as flood waters rise, Yeel is beginning to feel that perhaps he might finally be amenable to outside help.
gear: Other equipment aboard the Tireless Wanderer

name: ISB Agent Lorn Bal
description: Bal has never enjoyed his assignment on Toydaria, as Hutt domination there means he cannot wield Imperial power as fully as he would desire. Faced with the opportunity to pursue someone he believes to be associated with the mysterious mercenary under ISB scrutiny, Bal is eager to deploy his forces far from Hutt attention and to grab Dresk and anyone with him for interrogation.

name: Stormtrooper: Jet Trooper
description: A constant sight across the galaxy, stormtroopers exist as a constant reminder of the Empire’s power. On Toydaria, some squads deploy wearing jetpacks, allowing them to counter any targets who seek to escape into the skies.
notes: At the Game Master’s discretion one member of each minion group may be armed with a light repeating blaster with sling.
gear: Jetpack (Allows user to function as a Silhouette 1, Speed 2, Handling 0, System Strain Threshold 3 vehicle that can only operate in atmosphere and requires Piloting: Planetary to operate)

name: Riar Air Patrol Pursuit Drone
description: These disc-shaped drones are fast, but not particularly well armoured. They are designed to capture suspects rather than destroy their craft, and so are armed with potent ion mesh arrays. As they are relatively cheap but effective, Riar Starport authorities use them in high number to ensure that air traffic routes remain clear.
notes: The provided weapon profile is vehicle scale.

abilities.name: Latch-On
abilities.description: Once at Close range, make an opposed Piloting: Planetary check against target vehicle to affix drone to target.

abilities.name: Jet Powered
abilities.description: While aloft, the drone functions as a Silhouette 1, Speed 3, Handling +2, System Strain Threshold 2 vehicle.

name: Red-Eye Dren
description: Dren has operated deep within Kwenn for many years now, trading titbits of information for credits and more information. His signature glowing eyes are only the most obvious of his cybernetic replacements. Through his access to a wide variety of databases, Dren has made himself invaluable to criminal elements throughout the region.

abilities.name: Customised Cybernetic Eyes
abilities.description: Add :advantage::advantage: to Perception checks; add :setback: to Negotiation and similar checks made against Dren by beings looking at his eyes.

weapons.name: Optical flare
weapons.notes:
Characters who see the flare must make a :daunting: Resilience check or become blind for two rounds per :failure: and gain a :setback: for every :threat: until the end of the encounter.

A failed check with :despair: means the target is Blinded as per the Critical Injury Result table in the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, page 225.

name: Sprantal
description: Sprantal are massive amphibians with thick hides, long legs, and longer necks. They are typically a deep mottled-green colour that helps camouflage them, particularly underwater. Their flat heads have three spherical eyes on top in a triangular arrangement, giving them a 360-degree view. When they hide underwater, their heads are just under the surface, allowing the dark-coloured eyes to remain above the water to watch for potential prey and enemies. Sprantal have an additional, forward-facing eye below their wide, toothy mouth that allows them to see underwater as well as giving them a better view when attacking prey. Their stout bodies are approximately three to four metres long and half again as wide. Their necks can extend in a highly flexible manner, allowing sprantals when standing at full height to attack creatures everywhere except directly to the rear.

abilities.name: Sprantal Spit
abilities.description: If Blast activates, any additional targets that are hit suffer the same effects as the target. Ensnare requires :advantage: to activate. Any creature ensnared may attempt an Athletics check to free itself: the difficulty starts at :average: and increases by one level each round, to a maximum of :formidable:. After three hours the spit becomes brittle and falls apart.

name: Belonuk (Adult)
description: Belonuks are powerful quadrupeds. They have a bone-like armoured head, which they use to ram enemies and knock them over. Their powerful necks do not allow for much range of motion, but their deep-set eyes are widely spaced, giving them an excellent field of vision. Adult belonuks have sharp claws and even sharper needle-like teeth that can pierce the hide of even the toughest of Dathomir’s legendary creatures.

abilities.name: Belonuk Charge
abilities.description: Make an opposed Brawl check vs. Athletics or Coordination: if the Belonuk is successful the target is knocked prone, suffering Wounds equal to :success: and Strain equal to :advantage:.

abilities.name: Belonuk Trample
abilities.description: Against an opponent that is already prone or is one Silhouette size smaller than the belonuk, then as an action, make an opposed Brawl vs. Coordination or Resilience check. If the belonuk is successful, target is knocked prone until the end of their next turn and suffers Wounds equal to :success: and Strain equal to :advantage:.

name: Belonuk (Young)
description: The younger of the species refrain from charging individually, instead using swarm tactics to overwhelm their foes. They minimise their exposure to other predators by grabbing their prey and hiding them away as quickly as possible.

abilities.name: Belonuk Pack Tactics
abilities.description: Add :boost: to the combat check for each belonuk in the group.

abilities.name: Belonuk Scramble
abilities.description: May grab a prone target with a successful Brawl check and immediately drag the target one range band; the target is immobilised by the pack, and subsequent attempts to drag the target require an opposed Athletics check.

name: Vursonk
description: The vursonk is a small scavenging creature with six strong, whip-like tentacles equally spaced around the perimeter of an egg-shaped body, Its mouth is on the underside, with flaps that allow it to expand its maw and grab objects almost as large as itself. The creature has multiple eyes on each side of its body, giving it excellent all-around vision in light, and infrared vision in the darkness. A vursonk latches onto organic matter and either eats it in place or launches itself into the air for a fast getaway, taking the food back to a safe area for storage until later. It may make several trips if there is a ready supply of potential sustenance.

abilities.name: Force Power: Enhance
abilities.description: When making an Athletics check, the vursonk combines it with an Enhance power check, rolling :force:; may spend :darkside: to gain :success: or :advantage:, or may spend :lightside: by using a Destiny Point and suffering 1 Wound per :lightside: used.

abilities.name: Infrared Vision
abilities.description: The vursonk can see heat signatures up to thirty metres away.

weapons.name: Teeth
weapons.notes: When the vursonk leaps onto a targeted object, it envelops the object in its mouth and attempts to jump away with it.

name: Eerig, Nightbrother Lieutenant
description: One of several Nightbrother seconds under Freff’s leadership, Eerig had been uneasy about this mission. This feeling has diminished, though, as the Nightbrothers have followed Jerserra deeper into the ruins of the lost ship. He and his group are now ready to fight for her, no matter the threats they face from her foes or the dangerous surroundings.

name: Nightbrother
description: Like all Nightbrothers, these Zabrak males seem to exist only to serve the Nightsisters. When Jerserra returned to Dathomir, this local tribe quickly came to her side to fight off any who would oppose her.

name: Freff, Nightbrother Leader
description: Freff is highly honoured to be part of Jerserra’s quest, having seen first-hand not only her powers with the Force but also her resources as a mercenary leader. Now that she is deep underground with the Nardithi cluster in her command, his awe of her has only grown, while her powers have increased.
gear: Datapad with pathway guidance notations and mapping protocols enabled

abilities.name: Force Power: Unleash
abilities.description: The manifested Narditihi Nightsister makes a Force power check targeting one enemy at Short range, and rolls a ranged attack as part of the pool, using an :average: Discipline check instead of normal difficulty. If the check is successful and generates :forcepip::forcepip:, the attack deals 3 damage with a critical rating of 4, plus 1 additional per :success:. May spend :forcepip: to increase damage by 2 and :forcepip: to increase range to Medium.

weapons.name: Unleash
weapons.notes: May spend :forcepip: to increase damage by 2 and :forcepip: to increase range to Medium.

name: Jerserra (Late)

abilities.name: Force Power: Jerserra’s Influence
abilities.description: Jerserra may spend :forcepip: and target one character per :forcepip: within Short range. That character must immediately make a :hard: fear check as an out-of-turn Incidental. If the target suffers Strain as a result of that fear check, she recovers an amount of Strain equal to the total suffered. She may also spend :forcepip: to target one additional character, and :forcepip: to extend the power’s range to Medium.

abilities.name: Force Power: Move
abilities.description: Jerserra may spend :forcepip: to move one Silhouette 0 object within Short range to another location within Short range. She can spend :forcepip: to increase range one band, spend :forcepip: to increase Silhouette movable to 1, and spend :forcepip: to increase number of objects movable at one time by one (to a maximum of two). Jerserra can hurl objects by making a Move Force power check and rolling a ranged attack as part of the pool. The attack’s difficulty is equal to the Silhouette of the object being thrown and only succeeds if she can spend enough :forcepip: to move the object. The attack deals damage equal to the Silhouette of the object times 10 (Silhouette 0 deals 5 damage) plus one per :success:. To throw multiple objects, she must generate enough :forcepip: to move multiple objects, and must use rules for Auto-Fire to determine difficulty and targeting.

abilities.name: Force Power: Unleash
abilities.description: Jerserra makes a Force power check and targets one enemy at Short range, and rolls a ranged attack as part of the pool, using an :average: Discipline check instead of normal difficulty. If the check is successful and generates :forcepip::forcepip: the attack deals 3 damage with a critical rating of 4, plus 1 additional damage per :success:. May spend :forcepip: to increase damage by 2, and :forcepip: to increase range to Medium.

weapons.name: Unleash
weapons.notes: May spend :forcepip: to increase damage by 2 and :forcepip: to increase range to Medium.

gear: Hand-held holoprojector with pathway guidance notations and mapping protocols enabled
